leaf.name: Target objects are in well-formed format

property.description: Indicates whether the format of the object is well formed

leaf.name: Target objects are in declared format

property.name: format conforms
property.description: Indicates whether the format of the result conforms to the output format specified by the component.

node.name: Significant properties
node.description: This branch contains significant property descriptions of various types of objects in different scenarios.

deviation in percentage of image size

node.description: Significant properties for electronic theses, based on a case study.

node.name: Relational databases
node.description: This fragment describes significant properties of relational databases. It is derived from a case study on relational database preservation. The scenario is an archive, main focus of interest is software independence and the content itself, not the original application and its usage.

ordinalScale.restriction: number of rows identical for all tables/rows lost

mapping.ordinal: number of rows identical for all tables

ordinalScale.restriction: compatible to original/not compatible to original/lost
number of columns identical for all tables/columns lost

mapping.ordinal: number of columns identical for all tables

ordinalScale.restriction: all/all containing views or tables that are visible to archive users/incomplete/none

mapping.ordinal: all containing views or tables that are visible to archive users

ordinalScale.restriction: converted to SQL99/unchanged/converted to a table/unavailable
all/all connected to privileges or tables or views/some missing/none

mapping.ordinal: all connected to privileges or tables or views

ordinalScale.restriction: all/all connected to privileges or tables or views/some missing/none

mapping.ordinal: all connected to privileges or tables or views

ordinalScale.restriction: all/all connected to objects, users or roles/some missing/none

mapping.ordinal: all connected to objects, users or roles

node.name: Scanned images
node.description: This fragment describes significant properties of scanned images. It has been created by merging several case studies analysing preservation actions for scanned images in national libraries. We distilled the trees, merged the criteria and factors and mapped most criteria to measurable properties.

leaf.name: image size identical
leaf.description: This requirement also says something about the stability of the tool used for migration. In case the tool crashes the image size might not be identical. The same pertains to "image identical"

leaf.name: image identical
leaf.description: The pixel information must be the same. This requirement also says something about the stability of the tool used for migration. In case the tool crashes the image might not be identical. The same pertains to "image identical"

leaf.name: original size identical
leaf.description: If the 'original size' was preserved. If this information is lost the digital image is not authentic any more because the size of the scanned page is lost.

leaf.name: existent OCR still valid
leaf.description: If there is OCR data from the source image is available can it be applied to the migrated object or do we have to OCR the migrated objects again? This mainly refers to (x,y) location information OCR contains.

node.name: Scanned images (automated)
node.description: This fragment describes significant properties of images, but relies solely on properties that are automatically measurable at the moment. This means it can NOT be considered a complete tree, unfortunately, but is still rather complete in its coverage of decision factors. It is also being used for fast track evaluation.

property.name: image similarity
property.description: Quantitative indication of similarity between source and result. A variety of distance metrics for image comparison are available.

metric.name: equal
metric.description: Comparison of two values for equality

property.name: image similarity
property.description: Quantitative indication of similarity between source and result. A variety of distance metrics for image comparison are available.

property.name: image width
property.description: Width of an image, measured in number of pixels on the x-axis.

metric.name: equal
metric.description: Comparison of two values for equality

property.name: image height
property.description: Height of an image, measured in number of pixels on the y-axis.

metric.name: equal
metric.description: Comparison of two values for equality

metric.name: preserved
metric.description: Indicator if all values in source measurement do exist in result measurement
